results.title: Romy and Michele's high school reunion
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Bungalow 78, Laurence Mark and David Mirkin
results.brief_description: Two friends - Romy and Michele - are ten years out of high school when they are invited to a class reunion. The two women have escaped their hometown for Los Angeles but things haven’t turned out quite as planned. Pouring over their high school yearbook provides the opportunity for a series of flashbacks about their (at times) gruesome school days. Four bitchy women - the A group - played a key part in Romy’s teenage angst, compounded by her crush on the boyfriend of the ringleader. Michele is a more blithe character who sees the school days as glorious fun, blissfully unaware that she and Romy were the butt of many jokes. Other characters are Heather (Janeane Garlfalo), a depressed and lovelorn chain-smoking teen who has become a wealthy inventor; and Sandy (Alan Cumming) a science nerd in love/lust with Michele who has become a self-made millionaire. Pre-reunion the girls start to panic that their lives are fruitless, so decide to make up histories that will supply them with more appealing profiles. “Romy and Michele’s high school reunion” is a comedy and buddy film that draws heavily on a 1980s soundtrack and fashion and has an appealing duo in the two leads.

results.title: Romper stomper
results.creator_credit: Seon Films, Film Victoria, Australian Film Commission, Daniel Scharf, Ian Pringle and Geoffrey Wright
results.brief_description: This controversial movie is an exploration of a group of skinheads in the Melbourne inner-city suburb of Footscray who are angry at the Asian-Australians who live amongst them. The film’s evasions are obvious: the narrative it explores belongs as much to the outer suburbs as it does to the multi-ethnic inner suburbs. The director’s scripting and characterization is firmly and deliberately humanistic and sentimental; however the representation of some of the characters appears one dimensional and limited. Despite these shortcomings, “Romper Stomper” is an important Australian film in that it raises complicated issues of class, ethnicity, identity and nationalism. Its reception in the rest of the world was much more critical than its reception in Australia. With excellent performances by Russell Crowe, Daniel Pollock and Jacqueline McKenzie.

results.title: Romero
results.creator_credit: Paulist Pictures, Four Seasons Entertainment, Ellwood Kieser and John Duigan
results.brief_description: In a country ruled by a violent and oppressive military government, in a time when brutality, torture and murder destroyed a nation, one man rose to become the voice of the voiceless, champion of the poor, defender of human rights. Archbishop Oscar Romero of El Salvador stands beside Martin Luther King and Gandhi as one of history’s most heroic martyrs, whose courage and compassion became legendary. Romero’s influence on the people became so great in fact, that the military junta feared his power. In 1980, Bishop Romero died for his beliefs… at the hands of an assassin. His murderers have never been brought to trial. Raul Julia delivers a powerfully disturbing portrait of a man whose vision was truly inspirational.

results.title: Romeo and Juliet
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Irving G. Thalberg and George Cukor
results.brief_description: This lavish production of Shakespeare’s Romeo and Juliet features Leslie Howard and Norma Shearer as the star-crossed lovers. Cast also includes John Barrymore, Edna May Oliver, Basil Rathbone, C. Aubrey Smith, Andy Devine.

results.title: Romance (E)
results.creator_credit: Flach Film, Canal+, CB Films (France), Arte, Jean-Francois Lepetit and Catherine Breillat
results.brief_description: ‘Romance’ is a sexually explicit film that is more concerned with the psychological implications of sex than the physical act itself. Marie (Caroline Ducey), a young primary school teacher, is deeply disturbed by her narcissistic male model boyfriend’s behavior, who refuses to show her any kind of physical affection, much less make love to her. In an attempt to find a balance between the physical and emotional aspects of love, Marie embarks on a succession of brief encounters of the purely carnal kind with Paolo (played by Italian porn star Rocco Stiffredi), the ultimate latin lover, and Robert (Francois Berleand), an older man, who initiates her to S&M games. Although the film has its source in the French tradition of sexually charged writing that stretches from De Sade to de Beauvoir, Bataille, and Foucault, ‘Romance’ fast became a ‘success de scandale’ for its explicit showing of sex. The film was originally refused classification (ie: banned) in Australia by the Office of Film and Literature Classification for contravening the guidelines of an ‘R’ rating. This decision was later overturned by the Classification Review Board, thus re-igniting (albeit, briefly) the debate of censorship and public morality in Australia. Cast includes Thomas Sagamore Stevenin. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Roman holiday
results.brief_description: Audrey Hepburn won an Academy Award for her portrayal of a modern-day Princess rebelling against her royal obligations who escapes a goodwill tour to explore Rome on her own. She meets an American newspaperman (Gregory Peck) who, seeking an exclusive story, pretends ignorance of her true identity. Eddie Albert contributes to the fun as Peck’s carefree cameraman pal. Stylishly directed by William Wyler, this romantic comedy bubbles along at a fine pace, and when the day of fun is over the Princess and the reporter are in love, but each knows that nothing can come of the Roman holiday!

results.title: Rock all night
results.creator_credit: American International Pictures (AIP) and Roger Corman
results.brief_description: Set in a seedy bar called “Cloud Nine”, this hostage drama features some fine rock and roll by The Platters and The Blockbusters. When a pair of gunmen decide to hold the patrons and musicians hostage, Shorty, (a vertically challenged hot-headed regular) takes exception. Abby Dalton (who would go on to star in several other Corman movies) plays a fledging singer who is auditioning for a regular spot at the bar. Originally released on a double bill with “Dragstrip girl”, this is a classic Roger Corman cheapie (reputedly shot in just five days) with Mel Welles a high point as the hip-talking Beatnik showbiz agent. Also stars Russell Johnson, as one of the thugs, later to be a feature player in “Gilligan’s Island”.

results.title: Rocco and his brothers
results.creator_credit: Titanus, Les Films Marceau, Goffredo Lombardo and Luchino Visconti
results.brief_description: From Italy’s most controversial director comes a challenging and sometimes harrowing vision of cultural and economic strife. A poor Southern family travels to Milan in the thriving industrial North, where they are beset by violent misfortune. Blending the styles of harsh neo-realism with the grandiose operatic strokes of tragic melodrama, this story is an uncompromising portrait of the rigours of modern life, and a milestone in Italian political cinema. Cast includes Alain Delon and Claudia Cardinale. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Robocop
results.creator_credit: Orion Pictures Corporation, Arne Schmidt and Paul Verhoeven
results.brief_description: In the corrupt, crime-ridden Detroit of the future, a multi-national conglomerate has assumed control of the Police Department. Law is now a business and proft essential. When Officer Murphy, (Peter Weller) is brutally murdered by vicious criminals, his body is transformed into a cyborg: Half-man, Half-robot - ROBOCOP. Equipped with the fastest reflexes modern technology can offer, onboard computer-assisted memory and a lifetime of on-the-street law enforcement, ROBOCOP launches into a relentless quest to serve, uphold and protect. Features non-stop action, comic book humour and electrifying special effects. Co-starring Nancy Allen, Daniel O’Herlihy, Ronny Cox, Kurtwood Smith and Miguel Ferrer.

results.title: Robin Hood [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Wolfgang Reitherman
results.brief_description: This animated feature was one of the first films to be made by Disney after Walt’s death in 1967. Adapting the story of Robin Hood, in this take all the protagonists are animals - Robin is a handsome fox (very much in Errol Flynn mode), Little John is a bear and Prince John a lion. When the greedy sheriff taxes the citizens of Nottingham to the point of bankruptcy, Robin Hood, a benevolent outlaw arrives to save them all. Director Wolfgang Reithermann has created a fantastic animal kingdom in which to set the classic tale of the inhabitants of Sherwood Forest. Voices include: Peter Ustinov and Terry-Thomas, Andy Devine, Barbara Luddy, Roger Miller and Monica Evans.
